â€œHow is it possible, I wondered, that a woman knows how to think like that. I worked so hard on books, but I endured them, I never actually used them, I never turned them against themselves. This is thinking. This is thinking against. Iâ€”after so much exertionâ€”donâ€™t know how to think. Nor does Mariarosa: sheâ€™s read pages and pages, and she rearranges them with flair, putting on a show. Thatâ€™s it. Lila, on the other hand, knows. Itâ€™s her nature. If she had studied, she would know how to think like this.â€
